hook.text: China grew 10% annually for 30 years under authoritarianism. India grew 6% under democracy.

buildup.text: Lee Kuan Yew argued development requires 'discipline, not democracy.

discovery.text: Amartya Sen countered: no democracy has ever suffered a famine.

twist.text: The data is ambiguous: some authoritarian regimes grow fast (China), many grow terribly (Zimbabwe).
